Again, these guarda of ours should show how they were driven by the Dutch from their charge and from the possession of the ship without any fault on their part. No battle is mentioned, and the defense would have been very easy in that place where these very Dutchmen had been made prisoners without any trouble a little while before. Or if any violence has been offered, would not the Vice- Admiral have punished the Dutch, as his duty, as the wrong done his men, as the wrong done to himself required? He is not excus-
